review: Only had it for a month, so time will tell on a lot of the variables--e.g., how long until I have to buy another one?--but it has been exactly what we needed. We were watching Netflix and listening to Pandora on a laptop previously, and this is just way better. Don't get this if you don't have Amazon Prime or Netflix. Obviously, a lot of smart TVs will phase this out of the market, but until we have one, we are very happy with this.
author: mcj333

review: First I want to say I DO NOT work for Amazon and am under no obligation to write anything nice about this product. I do buy a lot of things from Amazon and this is absolutely one of the best. I have an Apple TV and a Fire Stick both hooked up to my TV. There is no comparison where the Stick does not out perform the Apple devise. The Stick is fast and accurate. I have NEVER experienced any buffering and that is huge for me. I hate when a stream is stuck and you sit and watch. Even Netflix, which is very twitchy, comes through fast and uninterrupted. I have to say that after spending thousands of dollars on products from Amazon, this is by far the best money I ever spent. Try it. It's worth it and it doesn't cost much.

author: Amazon Customer

review: I think the Fire TV stick itself is a great value and would have gotten 5 stars if it were not for frequent long interruptions in broadcast. My son tells me that it is not the Fire Stick's fault, it is the fault of Comcast. I actually don't know for sure. I do know that we have Comcast's fastest download speed. My son explains that Comcast limits bandwidth to Fire stick type products because they are a low cost direct competitor. In summary I would say the value is very high but so is the annoyance due to the frequent pauses. Why 3 stars? It would have gotten 5 stars if no interruptions and 1 star if the interruptions are the fault of the Fire Stick so 3 is a best compromise.
